title: Clara Barton National Historic Site: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar       Performances of "Clara Barton: Red Cross Angel" by Mary Ann Jung - Free Sunday, March 15, 2015 at 12:00 noon and 2:00 p.m. performances in the Bumper Car Pavilion at adjacent Glen Echo Park. Open House at Clara Barton NHS from 1:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m.  Saturday, April 11, 2015 at 2:00 p.m. performance in the Bumper Car Pavilion at adjacent Glen Echo Park Open House at Clara Barton NHS from 3:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m.   Â    Clara Barton - An American Life and Clara Barton - Between the Bullet and the Battlefield In celebration of Women's History Month in March 2015, these two presentations will be featured at the following DC Public Library locations. Attend a presentation and learn the remarkable story of the Civil War heroine and founder of the American Red Cross, Clara Barton. These free, 45-minute programs will be presented by National Park Service Ranger Kevin Patti. For more information, please visit www.dclibrary.org or call Clara Barton National Historic Site at 301-320-1410. Clara Barton - An American Life March 18 at 1:00 p.m. - Palisades Neighborhood Library, (202) 282-3139 Clara Barton - Between the Bullet and the Battlefield: March 11 at 7:00 p.m. - Takoma Park Neighborhood Library, (202) 576-7252 March 25 at 7:00 p.m. - Mt. Pleasant Neighborhood Library, (202) 671-3121 March 28 at 10:00 a.m. - Southeast Neighborhood Library, (202) 698-3377
